ARABIC: مِن فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَالِيًا مِّنَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: from Pharaoh - he was haughty, one of the profligate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They (had experienced) under the Pharaoh. He was certainly a tyrant, guilty of excess.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: from Pharaoh who was most prominent among the prodigals.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and from the Pharaoh. He was the chief of the transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: From Firaun; he was indeed proud, among the transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: From Fir`awn; verily, he was arrogant and was of the excessive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: From Firon; surely he was haughty, (and) one of the extravagant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: from Pharaoh; surely he was a high One, of the prodigals;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (We delivered them) from Pharaoh. Lo! he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: at the hands of Pharaoh: he was a tyrant who exceeded all bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: From Fir'awn; verily he was haughty and of the extravagant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: of Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a tyrant among the transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Inflicted by Pharaoh, for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: From Fir'aun (Pharaoh); Verily! He was arrogant and was of the Musrifun (those who transgress beyond bound in spending and other things and commit great sins).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: from Pharaoh, who ranked high in sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: From Pharaoh. He was a transgressing tyrant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:31] from Pharaoh (min Fir‘awna, is said to be a substitution for al-‘adhābi, on the basis of an implied annexation, that is to say, [min] ‘adhābi [Fir‘awna]; or it is said to be a circumstantial qualifier referring to al-‘adhāb, ‘the chastisement’). Truly he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((We delivered them) from Pharaoh) and his folk who slaughtered their males and used their females as servants. (Lo! he was a tyrant) he was an arrogant transgressor (of the wanton ones) steeped in idolatry.
